metadata.job_to_be_done: Prepare a vegetarian buffet-style dinner menu for a corporate gathering, including gluten-free items.

extracted_sections.section_title: Egg noodles or rice for serving

subsection_analysis.refined_text: • 1 whole wheat tortilla • 1 cup cooked chicken breast, sliced • 1 cup romaine lettuce, chopped • 2 tablespoons Caesar dressing • 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese • Optional: croutons for extra crunch • Lay the tortilla flat and spread the Caesar dressing evenly. Add the chicken, lettuce, and Parmesan cheese. Roll up the tortilla tightly and slice in half.

o Scramble eggs in the same pan. Add noodles, fish sauce, tamarind paste, sugar, and lime juice, stir to combine. Add bean sprouts, cooked shrimp, and chopped green onions. o Garnish with crushed peanuts and serve.  o 1 cup flour o 1 cup water o 1 egg o 1/2 cup green onions o 1/2 cup seafood (optional) o 1 tablespoon soy sauce o 1 tablespoon sesame oil  o Mix flour, water, and beaten egg in a bowl.

 1 pound beef sirloin, thinly sliced  1 small onion, diced  2 cloves garlic, minced  1 cup mushrooms, sliced  1 cup beef broth  1 cup sour cream  2 tablespoons flour  2 tablespoons butter  1 teaspoon paprika In a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add diced onion and minced garlic, sauté until translucent.  Add sliced beef and cook until browned.  Stir in mushrooms and cook until tender.

 1 teaspoon thyme  1 teaspoon rosemary  1/4 cup olive oil   Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, layer diced eggplant, zucchini, bell pepper, onion, and tomatoes. In a bowl, mix minced garlic, olive oil, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Pour the mixture over the vegetables and toss to coat.

• 1 cup all-purpose flour • 2 tablespoons sugar • 1 teaspoon baking powder • 1/2 teaspoon baking soda • 1/4 teaspoon salt • 1 cup buttermilk • 1 large egg • 2 tablespoons melted butter • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract • In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, combine buttermilk, egg, melted butter, and vanilla extract. Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and stir until just combined.
